item.content:encoded:
Last week we found ourselves at Walt Disney’s Magic Kingdom checking out the new Fantasyland updates that officially opens later this week. The updates to Fantasyland center around The Little Mermaid and Beauty and the Beast, and don’t stop at the rides. There are new restaurants, like the Be Our Guest experience in Beast’s castle, and quick serve locations as well, including Gaston’s Tavern.

Gaston’s Tavern, named for Gaston from Beauty and the Beast, is a quick serve serving giant pork shanks – think turkey legs, but in pork form – and other quick bites, but their feature is LeFou’s Brew, pictured above. If I didn’t know any better, I’d say this is Disney’s answer to Universal’s Butterbeer. However, if you don’t like butterscotch, like me, then while Butterbeer may not be your thing, LeFou’s Brew might be right up your alley.

It’s a frozen apple juice drink that has toasted marshmallow infused in the drink. It’s kind of amazing. The “head” of the drink is a mango-passion fruit foam topping. The whole thing is awesome. It sells for $9.99 in a plastic “souvenir” chalice or stein, or the much more palatable $4.99 for just the drink (pictured).

If you haven’t been out to Disney in awhile, or are huge fans of Beauty and the Beast or The Little Mermaid, then head out to see the new Fantasyland additions. It was a lot of fun and the food was pretty great too.
